--- title: "Admissions" execute: echo: false warning: false format: html: default pdf: default always_allow_html: true --- ## Admissions Despite months of closures at the start of the year and subsequent restrictions in the form of capacity limits and rules on social distancing, cinemas enjoyed significantly greater audience numbers in 2021 than in 2020. Admissions for the year totalled 74 million, up 68% compared with 2020, but still well below the level of attendances seen in 2019 ([@fig-admissions-html]{.content-visible when-format="html"}[@fig-admissions-pdf]{.content-visible when-format="pdf"}). ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.content-visible when-format="html"} ::: {.cell .column-page} ::: {#fig-admissions-html .cell-output-display} ```{=html}

As with the UK, the majority of territories saw increased attendances in 2021 in comparison with 2020 but cinema-going in every territory remained well below the level of admissions in 2019. The two territories reporting numbers of ticket sales in 2021 closest to those of 2019 were China (down only 32%) and Russia (-34%) while those with the greatest shortfall between 2019 and 2021 were Indonesia (-82%), Italy (-74%) and South Korea (-73%). According to Omdia, global cinema admissions in 2021 totalled 3.3 billion, an increase from 1.9 billion in 2020, but still 57% down on the 7.6 billion recorded in 2019. ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.content-visible when-format="html"} ::: {#tbl-markets-html .cell tbl-cap='Largest film markets by admissions, 2019-2021 (ranked by 2021 admissions).
